channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Netflix will buy Warner Bros' studio and streaming businesses for $72 billion
item.description: The merger, announced Friday, would bring two of the industry's biggest players in film and TV under one roof. Beyond its television and motion pictur...

item.title: The Kennedy Center Honors are coming up. This year's event will be different
item.description: President Trump has made major changes at the Kennedy Center this year, ousting the board chair and president, and naming himself host of the organiza...

item.title: Who is the Jan. 6 pipe bomb suspect? And, lawmakers see video of deadly boat strike
item.description: After a years-long investigation, the FBI has arrested a man accused of planting the Jan. 6 pipe bombs. And, lawmakers yesterday saw video of a deadly...

item.title: Are you a swing voter? We want to hear how you're feeling about politics
item.description: Do you think the country is going in the right or wrong direction? Are you happy with your vote last year or do you have any regrets? Or maybe you sat...

item.title: Has hope survived the war? We asked Israelis and Palestinians we spoke to in 2023
item.description: In 2023, we interviewed them to see how the Israel-Hamas war was affecting their ability to feel compassion and empathy. In the wake of the ceasefire ...

item.title: CDC panel votes to stop recommending birth dose of hepatitis B vaccine
item.description: The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices will no longer recommend infants receive a hepatitis B vaccination at birth, instead delaying t...

item.title: Namibia loses bid to overturn ban on rhino horn trade
item.description: Namibia has built up large stockpiles of rhino horn after pioneering the practice of cutting them off to deter poachers.

item.title: Shops empty in a Hispanic neighborhood as immigration crackdown comes to Louisiana
item.description: Federal border agents have descended on a Hispanic enclave just outside New Orleans and local business owners are suffering.

item.title: Netflix wins bidding war for Warner Bros. purchase
item.description: Netflix announced a deal to buy Warner Bros. for $82.7 billion. Barron's writer Paul La Monica joins CBS News with more.

item.title: Western countries press Tanzania to release bodies of post-election victims
item.description: There is evidence of extrajudicial killings, disappearances and the concealment of bodies, 17 embassies say.

item.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros film and streaming businesses for $72bn
item.description: The major Hollywood deal means Netflix will takeover ownership of franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.

item.title: Germany votes to bring back voluntary military service programme for 18-year-olds
item.description: The shift in its approach to its military follows a push to create Europe's strongest conventional army.

item.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (Dec. 7)
item.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the Emmy-winning program, hosted by Jane Pauley.

item.title: Amy Allen on her love for songwriting, working with Sabrina Carpenter and other pop stars
item.description: Amy Allen, who is up for four Grammys, including songwriter of the year, sits down with Anthony Mason to talk about how she went from a nursing studen...

item.title: Book excerpt: "My Beloved" by Jan Karon
item.description: The New York Times bestselling author returns to the village of Mitford in her 15th novel featuring Father Tim Kavanagh.

item.title: Olympian and other Eritreans freed after 18 years without trial, relatives tell the BBC
item.description: Ex-cyclist Zeragaber Gebrehiwot, who attended the 1980 Moscow Games, is among 13 released from a notorious jail.

item.title: Immigration crackdown in New Orleans has a target of 5,000 arrests. Is that possible?
Man accused of planting pipe bombs before Jan. 6 Capitol attack is charged with explosives offenses
